userreviews.userReview: Colleen Coble delivers another edge-of-your-seat romantic suspense in this fourth (and final) book in the Aloha Reef series. The books all read well as standalones so no worries if you haven't read the other novels. If you have though, you'll recognize Lani as the 'wild' child' Tagama sister, but now, as a new Christian, she is trying to put that past behind her for good. Trouble is, not everyone is willing to forget. Including Ben, who holds a pretty big grudge against her. Perfect fodder for an angsty love story.Not that this story really needs any more angst courtesy of the riveting suspense plot. There's murder, smuggling and danger lurking around every corner. And I just have to mention Fisher, the work-in-progress guide dog! I do love a great canine character to mix things up! A heart-pounding thrill of a read.

This book is the fourth and final novel [there is also a Christmas novella in the series called Holy Night] in a Christian suspense and romance series called The Aloha Reef series, as it is set in Hawaii, and, in addition to that, the books all have at least some connection to the sea, shown either through diving, normal swimming, or boating. Because the first three novels focused on pairing up the three Oana siblings, I was wondering what minor character from one of those novels would be starring on this one, and as it turned out, my first guess was wrong. Regardless of that though, the main character in this book is Lani Tagama, the sister of Annie from Black Sands, and in it, we learn not only about some of her history and how she has changed but also about her aunt both in the past and now. Lani's life is also affected by her aunt's past as a villain from back then intersects with the present, putting not only Lani but her new friend Ben and his niece in terrible danger all for varying reasons. Anyhow, I thought the book was well-written and entertaining, and the twists and turns of the plot due to the element of suspense/mystery were quite fun, and I also loved the characters in the book and thought they were portrayed well. It has certainly earned its place on my favorites' list.

Leilani Tagama is attempting to change her life when she is suddenly blinded by a mysterious shooting at her aunt's coffee farm. As she struggles to live with her new disability, Ben Mahoney is called in to help. Ben uses Fisher, the service dog he is training, to get onto the coffee farm for his own reasons. Soon both Ben and Lani suspect there is more behind the shooting than originally suspected. As they try to figure out what is going on before someone else gets hurt, they also have to work through their own pasts in order to move forward in their lives. Midnight Sea is an exciting read. The story moves quickly and the characters experience real discovery and growth. I wish there was a little bit more development of the "villain," but overall the characters were well-rounded and unique. I thoroughly enjoyed this book as I have all of Coble's work! I would highly recommend her.

I started reading this series 2 days ago, and finished reading it today. I am pretty sure I had already read the other 3 books in the series, though I don't remember much about them...... but I am positive I never read this, the 4th book in the series. This was an awesome series, but I think this was the best of all 4 books. I thought I knew who the bad guy was all through the book, only to find out I was wrong. I loved the main characters, especially Ben.....very cool guy. I appreciated the message of how God can change people so much and forgive anything they do, and that we have to forgive ourselves also and not hold onto guilt for something God has forgiven. Awesome read.
This is a satisfying conclusion to the Aloha Reef series by Colleen Coble. I'm sad it had to end! See my full review here.
This has been a fabulous series!
It was okay. Lot's of loose ends that didn't get wrapped up in the end.

Aloha!Another outstanding storyline . Lani, Ben, Fisher and Meg made this a wonderful read. Others like Mano and Annie from the first 3 books are here as well. If you like excitement, mystery and intrigue written with the backdrop in beautiful Hawaii then this is the book for you. It's also written with a Christian perspective.

I liked this book a lot better than the last one in this series. The storyline and characters captured my attention and kept me focused. I love that I rarely guess "who done it" in Coble's books, she does a good job of providing many possibilities.
Good story
Riveting! Colleen Coble is a master storyteller. Her attention to detail is amazing. The danger and suspense kept me turning the pages. I enjoyed this series!

SUMMARY: A seemingly random shooting at her aunt's coffee farm has left Lani Tagama blind. Now she must learn to navigate in a world of darkness. With the help of an embittered ex-cop, Ben, and a half-trained guide dog, Fisher, Lani discovers she can regain a shadow of her former independence.But strange and dangerous secrets lurk behind the beauty of this seaside paradise. Suspicion grows that this was not a random shooting, but an attempted murder, one with its roots in a hippie commune burned over thirty year ago. Lani realizes she is a target, and that she must find the shooter before he strikes again.REVIEW: This is the final book in Colleen Coble's Aloha Reef series. I have loved every one of them, but have to say I think this one ended the series with a real bang! From start to finish there was something happening that kept me wanting to turn pages faster and faster. One of her best romantic suspense novels yet.I found it very interesting reading about Lani's adjustment to being blind and to learning how to work with a service dog. It was obvious Coble did some research into both these areas. I also loved hearing about the "hippie commune." It brought back a lot of memories of hearing stories about these during that time period as I was a teen/young adult then. Coble had all the common "beach talk" down pat since I grew up in California and these were common terms even if you weren't a hippie.This story was rich and complex with secrets, suspense, and sweet romance. The faith thread was realistic as the main characters fought with the ever present question of why does God let bad things happen to good people. Another great series by Colleen Coble. Definitely made it to my 2016 favorite reads list.FAVORITE QUOTES: (Lots of good ones in this book. Here are a few.)"God doesn't make us do anything. He wast us to love and obey because we want to, not because we have no choice.""Some things only God could make better.""I have to trust God for the results. I have to keep my hands off the wheel. That's freeing when you think about it. I'm free to enjoy what God gives me and let him worry about making it all work out.""Sometimes the relationships that are the most strained are the hardest to lose. You know there's no second chance."

Colleen Coble in her new book “Midnight Sea” Book Four in the Aloha Reef series published by Thomas Nelson takes us into the life of Lani Tagama.From the back cover: Losing her sight turns Lanie’s world upside down, bringing danger, mystery…and unexpected romance.A seemingly random shooting at her aunt’s coffee farm has left Lani Tagama blind. Now she must learn to navigate in a world of darkness. With the help of an ex-cop named Ben and a half-trained guide dog, Lani begins to regain her former independence.Then Lani and Ben discover that her injury wasn’t caused by a random shooting. It was a botched murder attempt. They must work together to discover the identity of the would-be murderer before he strikes again.The novels in Colleen Coble’s popular Aloha Reef Series combine mystery and suspense with tender romance in an irresistible island setting.“Dangerous Depths” has a random shooting which may be a botched murder attempt. Lani is more than a handicapped victim she is a determined young woman who not only seeks justice but wants to make sure he cannot kill again. Ben is an ex-cop who helps in her investigation and is her romantic interest. Both Ben and Lani have issues that need to be resolved not only with each other but with God. The wonderful thing is God will forgive them and will help them heal from their past hurts. This is a fast-paced read that will keep you guessing as to what is really going on. Whenever you pick up anything by Ms. Coble you can be sure you will be reading a top-notch exciting story and a wonderful romance.Disclosure of Material Connection: I received this book free from Thomas Nelson. I was not required to write a positive review. The opinions I have expressed are my own. I am disclosing this in accordance with the Federal Trade Commission’s 16 CFR, Part 255: “Guides Concerning the Use of Endorsements and Testimonials in Advertising.”
[getting an abortion (hide spoiler)]

I really didn't care much for Lani in book two, but found her very likable in this book. When she witnessed a murder, was shot, and became blind she realized what was important in like. Ben, our hunky hero, was very lovable. Add Fisher, the seeing eye dog that he was training and you've got a wining combo. Unbeknownst to blind Lani, she and Ben have a past history. Ben despised her, but agreed to teach her how to be blind, when asked by her cousin, Bens former partner on the police force, for help in keeping her safe from the unidentified murder. Sparks start flying.  This book, along with book one, were my favorites of the series. Although a series favorite, it was difficult at times to follow. Character names were comingled, gaps or inconsistent story lines, and not as smooth flowing as the authors more recent books.

The book itself was good - although the plot was a little confusing at times - but that could have been just me. The part that really drew me to the book was this quote " I thought I had all the answers, but now I find I don't even know all the questions. I don't know why God let . . . Maybe I'll never know. But I have to trust God for the results. I have to keep my hands off the wheel. That's freeing when you think about it. I'm free to enjoy what God gives me and let HIM worry about making it all work out." Just the lesson I needed . . .

I had trouble following this book, though that could be partly because I didn't have much energy to put into it. Also, the emotions of the characters didn't come through well. Oh, someone died? Ok. Oh, they were actually murdered? Interesting. But it was a good story.

Just finished reading this book last night. I liked this book the best and can't explain why it just appealed to me the most out of all her books I read. Maybe because I can relate to Lani. She's an excellent writer, that's just me opinion.

I really enjoyed this book! The suspense and mystery was great! Downer: there were some issues with her past that I didn't like, but because the book clearly stated that she knew it was wrong what she did, I didn't mind it too much.
Hard to follow in many places and the story was slow to start. Still a good read.
Okay story of a past murder, a shooting and a coffee plantation. This book seemed to have too much going on and so wasn't very deep.
I've waited a long time to read this, and it is only now that I have the opportunity that I find out it's book 4 in a series- of which my library has none of the others.
just another great book by Colleen Coble. This is a continuation of the Alhoa Reef series
I didn't enjoy it as much as I thought I would
Good mystery and good underlying themes. I found two more of her books at the library today and am excited to read them.
I really liked this whole series too! I liked the setting, the action, the mystery, the romance (sigh...) and that it is Christian but not super preachy. Well done!
The mystery in this was exciting.The only down side was there was way too much kissing.
Clean and easy inspirational romance about a woman who must learn, through a tragedy, to deal with blindness.
Found on the Free shelf

description: "Lani opened her eyes fully, straining to see something, anything. It was as though she swam in a black sea that blacked out all light, all visual sensation. 'I can't see,' she whispered. 'I can't see!' Her shriek rose and echoed off the blackness."A seemingly random shooting at her aunt's coffee farm has left Lani Tagama blind. Now she must learn to navigate in a world of darkness. With the help of an embittered ex-cop, Ben, and a half-trained guide dog, Fisher, Lani discovers she can regain a shadow of her former independence.But strange and dangerous secrets lurk behind the beauty of this seaside paradise. Suspicion grows that this was not a random shooting, but an attempted murder, one with its roots in a hippie commune burned over thirty year ago. Lani realizes she is a target, and that she must find the shooter before he strikes again.
